detail.content: Special Interest Projects (SIPs) | NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                                                                  Home   About Us   Health Promotion Research   Education & Training   Dissemination   News & Events                                  Home Health Promotion Research Special Interest Projects (SIPs)            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Health Promotion Research        open/close   Reaching Immigrants through Community Empowerment (RICE)   Dental Health Promotion Program   Comparative Effectiveness Research (CER)     open/close   Special Interest Projects (SIPs)  Muslim Americans Reaching for Health and Building Alliances (MARHABA)   Nutrition and Obesity Policy Research and Evaluation Network (NOPREN)     Educating Latinos for Better Resources, Outreach, and Nutrition Excellence (EL-BRONX)     open/close   Policy Research   Evaluation                                                                                                    Special Interest Projects (SIPs)                                                      In addition to core research projects, PRCs also conduct additional research called Special Interest Projects (SIPs). A SIP is a health promotion and disease prevention project funded by a division of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention or other Health and Human Service agency. A SIP focuses on a topic of itnerest or a gap in knowledge or research. It can also support the development of effective state and local public health programs and policies. Only currently funded PRCs are eligible to respond to SIP announcements and projects are competitively selected through a peer-review process.    The NYU PRC currently houses two SIPs:   MARHABA (Muslim Americans Reaching for Health and Building Alliances)   NOPREN (Nutrition and Obesity Policy Research and Evaluation Network)                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

CDC PRC Resources | NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                                                                  Home   About Us   Health Promotion Research   Education & Training   Dissemination   News & Events                                  Home About Us CDC PRC Program CDC PRC Resources            Print  Email               - A + A                                         About Us      People     open/close   CDC PRC Program  CDC PRC Resources     PRC Advisory Board   Community Based Participatory Research   Community Health Workers   Contact Us                                                                                                    CDC PRC Resources                                                      Prevention Research Centers, designated by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, constitute a network of academic, community, and public health partners that conducts applied public health research. PRCs create health promotion and disease prevention strategies that work and can bring long-term benefits to communities. PRCs also offer training and technical assistance to the public health community.   ________________________________________________________      Profiles of PR Cs in the Network       Each PRC has a profile that contains the center’s core research focus, contact information, and links to research project descriptions and the center’s website.   ________________________________________________________      Video Overview   A 5-minute video introduces the PRC Program.       ________________________________________________________       PRC Achievements   The PRCs have contributed to scientific results and public health at local, state, national, and international levels. Achievements are summarized and organized by type of contribution. Achievements associated with CDC’s Winnable Battles are noted.           ________________________________________________________        Stories of Prevention Research   Researchers are making a difference in individual lives and having an impact on communities’ approach to health care.   ________________________________________________________   PRC Program Materials       Working Hand-In-Hand to Promote Community Health [PDF - 5.24MB]                    Prevention Research Centers [PDF - 1.35MB]                    National Community Committee [PDF - 1.55MB]                   Click here to review more program material produced by the PRC Program.   ________________________________________________________   Content provided and maintained by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Students | NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             NYU-CUNY Prevention Research Center                                                                                  Home   About Us   Health Promotion Research   Education & Training   Dissemination   News & Events                                  Home Education & Training Students            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Education & Training      Students     open/close   Conferences, Symposia, and Seminars   Health Professionals and Researchers     open/close   Community Leaders                                                                                                    Students                                                        Practical work experience is an essential part of the training of public health professionals. The NYU PRC offers carefully planned, highly supervised, and critically evaluated student training programs in partnership with the Center for the Study of Asian American Health (CSAAH) . All students work in close collaboration with community and academic advisors on activities critical to the function and missions of the NYU PRC and CSAAH.   Center Student Investigator (CSI) Program   To learn more about the Center Student Investigator (CSI) internship program, please click here .   Health Disparity Research Training Program (HDRTP)    The HDRTP provides highly qualified masters and doctoral students with an intensive 2-semester experience working on a community-based participatory research project. To learn more about the HDRTP, please click here .   NYU PRC ASPH/CDC/PRC Minority Health Fellow Shilpa Patel Presents During PRC Annual Meeting   Since 2002, the Association of Schools of Public Health (ASPH) has administered a Minority Health Fellowship Program to provide opportunities for underrepresented minority students to conduct doctoral-level research under the guidance and mentorship of prevention research experts at CDC-funded PRCs. Shilpa Patel, an ASPH/CDC/PRC Minority Health Fellow based at the NYU PRC, presented a poster titled, "Project RICE: Preliminary Findings from a descriptive study within the New York City South Asian and Korean Communities" at the Prevention Research Centers (PRC) 2011 Annual Conference in Atlanta, GA. Please click here to read about the other Fellows' presentations.
